ygData.subject: Re: Does anyone solo anymore?
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh, I agree, the xp is undeniably faster, and the role you play in a group is vastly different than soloing (I have a 55 druid myself who I ve spent 95% to the
ygData.messageBody:
Oh, I agree, the xp is undeniably faster, and the role you play in a
group is vastly different than soloing (I have a 55 druid myself who
I've spent 95% to the time soloing), but I have a 39 paladin that has
been an exclusive solo character and I do just fine. I average at
least one level per gameplay session and I don't have to rely on a
cleric to heal me or anyone else for that matter. My wife and I used
to exclusively duo/group and I felt myself squelched by others
(including her). I might want to go to a particular zone to get
steady xp or good loot without the hassles, but I would be overruled
or pushed into going someplace I really didn't want to go. Soloing
was my escape from dealing with that. I know that EQ is supposed to
be a social game, but sometimes, I just like to be alone.

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, j.Rigano@... wrote:
>
> Soloing dang i have been soloing since i started playing and getting
into a group seems strange at times for me id rather be in a group at
times makes game more fun i just wish groups would be more but seems
to me groups are slim to none.
> -------------- Original message ----------------------
> From: "Wulfric Rennison" <wulftech@...>
> > Not me. I prefer grouping. It's faster xp than soloing in my
opinion. As a 65
> > druid, I can solo a lot of things, but it takes too much time to
kill them.
> > Root, snare, dot, dot, dot. Sit and wait. Keep that up til the
mob is dead.
> > In a group, most times I only have to worry about snaring and
dotting, and maybe
> > back up healing. It's not as labor intensive, and the xp moves
faster with
> > constant pulls. Unfortunately, lately, it seems like it's been
increasingly
> > more difficult to find good groups so I end up soloing most of the
time anyway
> > with LFG on.
> >
> > W
> >
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Just Me
> > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > Sent: Sunday, April 16, 2006 1:04 PM
> > Subject: [EverQuest] Does anyone solo anymore?
> >
> >
> > After a year and a half of playing, I've done a lot of group
play and
> > a lot of duoing, but I seem to enjoy soloing more nowdays. I can go
> > where I want, do what I want and keep the loot and xp for myself.
> > Don't get me wrong, I still like to group, but sometimes, for my own
> > peace of mind, I much prefer soloing. Anyone else?
> >
> >
> >
> >
